item.description:
Think eating organic, vegan, or raw/living food is all you need in our diet to stay healthy? Think again! Even organic food is sadly lacking in  nutrients these days, and most raw food supplements and "superfoods" contain  mold. Ken Rohla will show you how to test your own food in your own kitchen  to see for yourself what you are actually eating, or rather, what you're  not! So what can you do about it? If you have the time and the land, you can grow your own food. You can grow sprouts to help. You can buy food-based  supplements and superfoods, but in sufficient quantities, that can get quite  expensive. Or you can make gallons of your own fresh supplements and  superfoods for pennies, including probiotics, enzymes, and antioxidants,  with high amounts of extremely regenerative ORMUS minerals, and imbue them  with very healing subtle scalar and other energies. Ken will also tell you how to use the same techniques to make your own kombucha (healing tea), pet  supplements, plant food, plant growth accelerator, compost accelerator,  nontoxic household cleaner, odor eliminator, mold and mildew remover, and more. Bring paper and writing instrument, Ken always gives out lots of very specific useful info!

There is a sample recording of two-hour talk Ken gave in Houston about ORMUS and growing nutrient-dense food: http://sampletalk.freshandalive.com

Ken Rohla is a Hippocrates Health Institute certified natural health  educator from New Smyrna Beach, Florida, and has been teaching classes and  retreats since 1993 on rejuvenation and cellular regeneration using raw and  sprouted vegetarian food, herbs, food-based supplements, detoxification, emotional healing, ancient esoteric techniques, and cutting edge science. With a background in engineering, physics, and computer science, for 23 years he worked a variety of jobs in the medical industry, from the patient level to the national policy level. A cutting edge researcher, Ken has studied with many pioneers in the natural health movement, including Gabriel Cousens, MD; Drs. Brian and Anna Maria Clement; David Wolfe;  Dr. Robert Morse; Viktoras Kulvinskas; Brenda Cobb;  and many others. In 2005, Ken became certified as a natural health educator by Hippocrates Health Institute in West Palm Beach, Florida, and is a guest lecturer there. In 2006 Ken was honored to work with Coretta Scott King, wife of the late Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. He may be contacted at www.freshandalive.com.

Feel free to print a Name Tag and contact members to carpool.
http://www.meetup.com/RawBoston/grow/nametags/

Use our Message Boards for more events and information.

item.name: FREE Talk @ PRANA: Ken Rohla - How to Make Probiotic Antioxidant Superfoods
